0.0.1.name: wordpress/wp-websnapr-thumbs
0.0.1.description:
WP Websnapr Thumbs is the most easy way to decorate your postings with a nice snapshot.

For a simple thumbnail just do something like:

[wst]http://urlToWebsite.tld[/wst]

The default class for the thumbnail is 'alignleft' which will make the thumbnail float to the left of your post. If you want to make it float to the right ('alignright'), do it like that instead:

[wst]r http://urlToWebsite.tld/wst

It's simple as that, yes. Just put an 'r' infront of the URL. :)

To LINK the thumbnail to the page it's showing do it like that:

[wstlink]http://urlToWebsite.tld[/wstlink]

respectively:

[wstlink]r http://urlToWebsite.tld/wstlink

if you want it to float right.

'alignleft' and 'alignright' are Standard-classes in Wordpress, if however your theme comes without them you may have to create
